page.title: 10Brixton Village
page.content: Mentioned in the Domesday Book as the Manor Brisestona.It is approximately 7 miles from Plymouth city centre on the A379.It was a linear village of cottages built for estate workers but subsequent developments are making it more nucleate.It has old cottages, modern semi-detatched houses and bungalows. Some are owned by South Hams district council and the rest are owned privately or by a village trust. 9 houses are being built on the lodge. There are about 1500 people living here now.There are 3 petrol/repair garages,garden centre, post office, general shops, greengrocers, butcher, fish & chip shop and 3 restaurants. There is also an old peoples home and a nursery home.There is a primary school.People worship at the parish church and a methodist chapel.Our village is very beautiful.
